Text: Obama's Presidential Library Will Be In Chicago, Foundation Announces    President Obama's presidential library will be in Chicago, his foundation announced on Tuesday.    "The future Presidential Center will include the library, museum, as well as office and activity space for the Foundation to inspire and engage citizens here and globally," the foundation said in a press release.    "It wasn't as easy for Chicago to win the Library as might be expected. The city had to scramble to find a solution when using park land for the location became an issue. Hawaii and New York also had strong bids, but Chicago is where President Obama grew up politically. He was a faculty member at the University of Chicago Law School for more than a decade."    The foundation puts it simply: The Obama family was "shaped by Chicago" from their "wedding day to Election Day."
